alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 10 at 2:56PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Seminole, east central Lake, northwestern Orange and south central Volusia Counties through 330 PM EST... At 256 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lockhart, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Deltona, Sanford, Apopka and Altamonte Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors! This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for east central Florida.

area.areaDesc: Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Seminole
